description: From Latin bibulus from bibō (“drink”) +‎ -ulus from Proto-Italic *pibō, from Proto-Indo-European *píph₃eti, from root *peh₃- (“drink”); whence also imbibe and beverage via Old French beivre.

adjectives.description: bibulous (comparative more bibulous, superlative most bibulous)

entries.meaning: Given to or marked by the consumption of alcoholic drink.
examples: Synonyms: bibacious, boozy, sottish; see also Thesaurus:drunk
